headline: MSc at Embedded Electronic System Design in Chalmers University
summary: Myself proficient Electronics and Communication Engineer with expertise in circuits and coding. As the Founder of Garage Exhauster, I specialize in developing online strategies, conducting company development, Sales analysis, Entrepreneurship and establishing partnerships. My technical skills encompass MATLAB, Microsoft Office and PCB design. With hands on experience in smart farming IoT projects during my internship at Farmzup, I am dedicated to innovation. Awarded for excellence in the National Level Science Olympiad and recognized as the Best Outstanding Student Coordinator, I bring a diverse skill set, leadership, and dedication to any professional endeavor.

experience.description: •Designed and developed custom boards, including Centraduino,Nano Alpha boards and Nano Z. •Specialized in LED solutions within television technologies, working on mechanism design. •Engaged in all phases of product development, collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive quality and managing component logistics to ensure client satisfaction. •Gained hands-on experience in 3D printing and assembly •Served as a STEM trainer, guiding clients through technology adoption and implementation. Show less

•Co-founded and scaled an innovative platform transforming the automotive parts and accessories market with a seamless online shopping experience. •Spearheaded business strategy, product development, and operations, driving significant revenue growth and product catalog expansion. •Led the development of a cutting-edge digital marketplace, integrating advanced technologies and establishing partnerships with suppliers and manufacturers. •Enhanced customer satisfaction through streamlined logistics and user-focused design, achieving high retention rates. •Gained expertise in e-commerce management, digital marketing, and strategic planning, with deep insights into the automotive online retail landscape. Show less

experience.position_title: Core Committee Member - Entrepreneurship Development Cell
experience.description: •Led a team to organize flagship events like SYCON 2022 (sponsored by HCL) and MELA, engaging 250+ participants and fostering entrepreneurial skills. •Coordinated workshops, mentorship programs, and networking sessions to empower peers with practical entrepreneurial knowledge. •Built strategic connections with industry leaders, enhancing the cell’s outreach and impact. •Recognized with the Best Outgoing Student Coordinator award for leadership and contributions to entrepreneurial development. Show less

•Worked on a project to control water pumps via mobile phones, managing water flow based on soil moisture levels. •Utilized a Wi-Fi module interfaced with an Arduino to establish communication between the mobile and water pumps. •Gained hands-on experience in integrating IoT technologies into farming for better water management. •Contributed to enhancing farming practices by automating irrigation and improving water usage efficiency. •Developed practical knowledge of embedded systems and wireless communication protocols. Show less

education.description: •Awarded the IPOET Scholarship for academic excellence and leadership potential. •Developing expertise in areas such as FPGA-based design, and microcontroller programming through coursework and hands-on projects. •Collaborating with industry experts and peers to address real-world challenges and innovate in the field of embedded systems. •Key Courses : Design of digital electronic systems,Introduction to integrated circuit design,Digital project laboratory,Methods for electronic system design and verification Show less

education.description: •Graduated with a strong foundation in electrical, electronics, and communication engineering, complemented by hands-on experience in innovative projects and technical problem-solving. •Actively contributed to technical symposiums and events, showcasing leadership and teamwork skills. •Awarded Best Outgoing Student Coordinator for significant contributions to the Entrepreneurship Development Cell. •Developed an automated vehicle identification system using license plate recognition with image processing and machine learning techniques. •Designed a high-rate wireless energy data transfer system to underwater instruments and achieved high-speed data transfer (50 kbps) through magnetic coupling in seawater. Show less

education.description: •Graduated with distinction, achieving an overall percentage of 94.35 in a comprehensive diploma program. •Developed a strong foundation in electronics and communication engineering, focusing on designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting electronic and communication systems. •Proficient in areas such as digital electronics, microprocessors, and embedded systems. •Hands-on experience through practical labs and projects, enhancing technical expertise and problem-solving skills.

•Completed Tenth grade, building a strong academic base and achieving a CGPA of 8 in the 10th-grade board examinations. •This period instilled essential skills in discipline, teamwork, and a lifelong curiosity for learning.

projects_topics: Smart Dual-Zone Temperature Monitoring System Using Nexys A7 FPGA
Wireless Data Transfer Using Magneto-Inductive Coil in Underwater
Number Plate Recognition Using Machine Learning
IoT-Based Temperature and Humidity Monitoring System
Integrated Natural Disaster Detection and Warning System

projects.name: Smart Dual-Zone Temperature Monitoring System Using Nexys A7 FPGA
projects.description: •Designed and developed an IoT-based Indoor-Outdoor Temperature Monitoring System to track and display temperature variations in real-time. •The system integrates temperature sensors with a microcontroller, enabling continuous monitoring and data visualization. •Real-time Monitoring: Utilized temperature sensors to measure both indoor and outdoor temperatures accurately. •Microcontroller Integration: Implemented an embedded system to process and display temperature readings. •Wireless Communication: Enabled data transmission using IoT protocols for remote accessibility. •User Interface: Designed a display system for easy temperature visualization. •This project enhanced my skills in embedded systems, sensor interfacing, IoT communication, and real-time data processing. Show less

projects.name: Wireless Data Transfer Using Magneto-Inductive Coil in Underwater
projects.description: •Studied magnetic coupling in seawater for wireless energy transfer and short-range communications. •Designed a high-rate wireless energy transfer link to recharge underwater instruments. •Optimized the operating frequency for high-speed data transfer (~50kbps). •Focused on enabling reliable data transfer underwater using magneto-inductive coils.

projects.name: Number Plate Recognition Using Machine Learning
projects.description: •Developed an image processing system for automatic vehicle identification using license plates. •Designed an efficient vehicle identification system for authorized access. •Implemented machine learning algorithms to improve accuracy in number plate recognition.

projects.name: IoT-Based Temperature and Humidity Monitoring System
projects.description: •Developed a system to measure and monitor environmental conditions such as temperature and humidity using the DHT11 sensor. •The DHT11 sensor provided calibrated digital output, ensuring accurate and reliable readings of temperature and humidity levels. •Integrated the sensor with an Arduino to facilitate real-time monitoring and data display, ideal for applications in climate control systems or environmental research. •The system ensured long-term stability and high reliability, offering continuous, precise measurements over extended periods of use. The project provided valuable experience in sensor integration, data acquisition, and real-time monitoring systems. Show less

projects.name: Integrated Natural Disaster Detection and Warning System
projects.description: •Designed and implemented an automated disaster detection system focused on detecting rising water levels and sending alerts to relevant authorities in real-time. •The system was controlled by a microcontroller and used a master-slave configuration. •The master module was designed using a PIC controller and communicated with two slave modules via Zigbee transceivers and RF modules. •The data was transmitted to a personal computer through RS232 for further processing and monitoring, allowing authorities to receive and assess the data quickly. •The project integrated a buzzer to alert nearby people in case of impending natural disasters, such as flooding, ensuring prompt evacuation and safety. •The system aimed to provide an efficient, low-cost solution for early warning and disaster management, demonstrating practical applications of wireless communication and embedded systems in emergency response scenarios. Show less
